programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of topical debate.

programme.title: Wild Isles (Our Precious Isles) S1 (1/5)
programme.desc: «Our Precious Isles»David Attenborough reveals our wildlife, from killer whales to cheeky puffins.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Love, Faith & Me S1 (2/5)
programme.desc: Chiedza is a Muslim convert. Can her new faith help in finding love and a husband?

programme.title: Moment of Proof S3 (4/15)
programme.desc: A jacket recovered from a suspect's home has the DNA of two stabbing victims on it.

programme.title: Moment of Proof S3 (5/15)
programme.desc: Fingerprints found after a break-in and brutal beating lead detectives to a murderer.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall S3 (3/15)
programme.desc: Rick visits Europe's largest tea plantation and makes a grand afternoon tea.

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast (Abersoch to Pwllheli) (3/8)
programme.desc: «Abersoch to Pwllheli»Weatherman Derek Brockway walks from Abersoch to Pwllheli on the Llyn Peninsula.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Impossible S4
programme.desc: Game show in which 24 players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day. In each episode there are three rounds, and the three highest scorers from each round play against each other in the final. The winner of this battle faces a £10,000 question.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain (Lincolnshire) (n°5)
programme.desc: «Lincolnshire»Si and Dave visit the pub that served the Dambuster Squadron.

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge (Nature) S2 (2/6)
programme.desc: «Nature»The nine remaining artists head to the Cotswolds to depict nature in all its glory.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Lynn and Mick's Romany Caravan) S2 (6/15)
programme.desc: «Lynn and Mick's Romany Caravan»Simon's team are in Surrey to help turn an old bow-top Romany caravan into a unique B&B.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S2
programme.desc: Silvia and Julian bought their bungalow near Brighton four years ago, after falling in love with the garden. They were less enamoured of the poky property - but promised themselves they'd transform it into their dream home in no time. Fast-forward four years, and that dream has become a nightmare. Competing to make their dreams come true are architects Robert Jamison and Laura Jane Clark.

programme.title: Flog It ! S16
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Watts Gallery in Surrey, the arts-and-crafts home of renowned artists Mary and George Frederic Watts. Experts David Harper and Natasha Raskin are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Some wonderful WWI medals catch Natasha's eye, while David is drawn to a fabulous collection of posters. Paul Martin uncovers the story of ceramicist and designer Mary Watts with a visit to her fabulous chapel.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (Nairn) S1 (16/20)
programme.desc: «Nairn»Edith Bowman and Colin Murray discover secrets of food producers at the Nairn Show.

programme.title: Between the Covers S6 (4/6)
programme.desc: Sara is joined by Sara Pascoe, Charlie Higson, Katie Melua and Adam Garcia.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs (The Land of Giants) S4 (4/6)
programme.desc: «The Land of Giants»Paul Murton travels through old Perthshire and the lochs of the northern Trossachs.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie presents the fourth semi-final of the classic quiz where contenders return to the black chair under the glare of the spotlight and the ticking clock to win a place in the grand final. The specialist subjects are Frank Zappa, the life and works of Siegfried Sassoon, pioneering British and Irish female aviators, and winners of the Eurovision Song Contest.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Phase two of the quarter-finals continues. Two teams return needing a win to stay in the competition, having both lost their first matches in this round. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders (The Perfect Man) S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: «The Perfect Man»The Chippendales show takes off, capitalising on the phenomenon of the girls' night out.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders (Strip the Layers) S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: «Strip the Layers»The bigger Chippendales gets, the more problems it faces.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: Herself
programme.desc: Sandra, on a long wait for housing, discovers a website that changes her life.
